column1: ARD / custom logic to display the criteria of a CW in an FDF for Approver and Auditor
column26:
We got the following request from ARD and this one is flagged in the RFP as mandatory latest for the planned Go Live in January 2024 but better to have it at the end of the UAT, planned for 28.02.2023!

1. When the traveler submits a statement then the Approver and the Auditor should see in an FDF (read only), why they received this statement via the Conditional Workflow.

2. In this FDF should be a dropdown with all the criteria we have defined for the Conditional Workflow for the Approver and Auditor and this criteria or severals ones should then be displayed. The wish from ARD is to have all criteria in the FDF and not only one. 

Actually we have defined 10 criteria for the Audtitor when an statement has to be checked and 7 criteria for the Approver. 

I have alreay discussed this with Mircea and from him comes this proposal with the FDF, so please get in contact with him if you need more information!
column222:
21/Sep/22 4:08 PM;griehser;Following CL Board of 21/09/2022:
 * Requirement accepted
 * Enabling such functionality doesn't impact the accounting files interface with SAP, hence only the conditional workflow (+*without*+ the display of the conditions why a step was skipped in the UI) will be implemented by end of February.
 * In terms of developments:
 ** EXM-337 is a pre-requisite to enable the display of the message from the conditional workflow as a non-blocking error message
 ** EXM-953 is the feature to return the message from the conditional workflow into the UI

cc: [~gheorghe] , [~salajan];;;
column223: 21/Sep/22 4:11 PM;salajan;[~mueller], so that Codebusters team can proceed with the implementation of the conditional workflow, please add all conditions here. Then this will be planned with the due date set for end of FEB23;;;
column225:
20/Nov/22 12:37 PM;mueller;[~salajan] please find attached the conditions for the ARD Conditional Workflow.
The conditions were finally approved by ARD on November 18th 2022.;;;

column222: 21/Sep/22 1:59 PM;mstaszek;KIBANA not available, I will change due date to 30.09;;;
column223:
10/Oct/22 12:26 PM;gmalarski;Lessons Learned

 

*Problem Description:*

Multiple occurance of  rg.graalvm.polyglot.PolyglotException in the *ama-es-Amadeus* system.

 

*Solution:*

Log debug added to each big decimal usage, in order to check what is exactly the root cause of the exception, when the exception appears again.

 

*Obstacles:*

Cannot reproduce on bail, so there was no possibility to investigate it precisely 

 

*For the Future:*

We need more data on how to reproduce the issue, maybe additional info from the engine team, some indicator should be created which will allow finding an exact line in the code where the problem occurred.;;;
column224:
14/Oct/22 11:52 AM;hilbich;You can check the statement logs with the correlation id and see that the error occurs in phase posting record generation and hook ExpenseData.
The stack trace shows that the error occurred in the BigDecimal class which can be identified to be a nullpointer in the constructor.
Based on that the error it has to be this line:
https://repository.secure.ifao.net:7443/projects/EXP/repos/engine-configs/browse/CalculationConfiguration/ama-es-amadeus/co/default/20170101-20220704/customlogic.properties.xml#236
The calculation setting was most likely null or not a number.
It is very unsecure to load a calculation setting based on another FDFs value and expect it to be always available.;;;
column225:
26/Oct/22 11:07 AM;gmalarski;Hello [~hilbich] and [~tsteinhaeuser]  ,

I have added a null check for the line you had emphasize.;;;

column1: ITE-1136 Teambank / Easycredit - correct configuration to avoid missing or invalid data error for "error.expense.200017"
column26:
Dear colleagues,

*{color:#de350b}please correct the configuration here:{color}*

[https://repository.secure.ifao.net:7443/projects/VEG/repos/ce-configs/browse/configurations/world/easycredit/TeamBank_AG_Niederlassung_AT/configurationAT2020_02_28.xml]

 

{color:#de350b}*as described below by Doreen and Oliver.*{color}

Thank you in advance and best regards,

Annette

 

Server:        world (staging / bali)

URL:            [https://world.cytric.net/easycredit]

                 {color:#de350b}  and if necessary also on {color}
                   [https://staging.cytric.net/easycredit]

                    [https://bali.sofia.ifao.net/ibe/?system=easycredit]

 

System:       easycredit

Location:    TeamBank AG, Niederlassung AT, Wien

Acting User Information:
 * User Name     400062
 * First Name     Thomas
 * Last Name      Terihay
 * Location         TeamBank AG, Niederlassung AT, Wien

Affected Expense ID    #11637086

Date / Time the issue occurred:      Draft created 08.08.2022 / 09:33 

Kibana:

error.expense.200017
 August 8th 2022, 09:35:35.125 ErrorMessage: code:null id: 0 class: debug message: error.expense.200017 values: null 11637086

 

*{color:#de350b}Information from{color}* https://jira.ifao.net/browse/ITE-1136:

*{color:#de350b}Doreen Ebert:{color}*

+*Issue as reported:*+
 The customer reports when creating an Expense Statement from Hotel Source, that there is no pre-defined receipt type in Expense

+*Root Cause:*+
 For the Austrian location, there is receipt types set up, however, Hotel is missing in the receipt behavior. Thus, we cannot pre-populate the Hotel receipt as it is not defined.

+*Solution:*+
 the system behaves as defined

+*Follow up:*+
 Correct the configuration

 

{color:#de350b}*Oliver Bürger:*{color}

[~skarja] you checked the correct configuration file.

[https://repository.secure.ifao.net:7443/projects/VEG/repos/ce-configs/browse/configurations/world/easycredit/TeamBank_AG_Niederlassung_AT/configurationAT2020_02_28.xml]

The configuration is missing an entry which defines the customer specific type of receipt that should be used when creating an expense statement based on a hotel booking. Please see [https://confluence.secure.ifao.net/display/EXPDLY/HOW+TO...+Setup+Receipt+Types] for more details on how to setup receipt types.

Here is an example of what is missing in the configuration:
{code:xml}
      <behavior type="${CLASS_StayBehavior}" code="SomeStayBehaviorCode" defaultValue="expense.basereceipt.receipt.hotel">
        <typeNames>          
            <typeName code="expense.basereceipt.receipt.hotel">
                <name locale="en_US">Hotelrechnung</name>
                <name locale="de_DE">Hotelrechnung</name>
            </typeName>
        </typeNames>
      </behavior> {code}

column1: EGIS - Meal allowed
column26:
Dear Team,

This CI is following  the CI-7228

Egis would like that theri is no combination of IBST+ BT31, BT32, BT34 and BT50 for the same lunch or dinner.

On the other hand, it is ok to cumulate 2 different meals in the same day, i.e. 1 IBST for lunch and 1 BT31, BT32, BT34 and BT50 for dinner (or inversely).

Please could you set up this behaviour?

Thank you.

Best regards,

Sandra
column222:
16/Sep/22 3:07 PM;mkuchciak;note:
 * IBST:
 ** BT40 - Indem. Business Short Term (IBST) LUNCH
 ** BT40 - Indem. Business Short Term (IBST) DINNER
 * BT31 - Lunch (France)
 * BT32 - Dinner (France)
 * BT34 - Meal (Out of France)
 * BT50 - Invitation;;;

Data of the location nexinsure should NOT be included within the export job.

Thanks! :);;;
column226:
19/Oct/22 9:36 AM;nsanchez;[~djagodzki] 

issue persists for following:

Two CSV files were transferred. One CSV file contains a m3 statement. The second CSV file contains the three test statements from Monday: ID12010577, 12010479, 12010791 - all for personnel number 4122

the Statements went to msg systems AG, msg services ag and msg GillardonBSM AG

At this point we have two errors:
 * delivery of two (several) CSVs!?
 * all trips of all locations must be delivered daily in one CSV!
 * Yesterday's test statements were not transferred to one of the two CSVs!

• The receipts for the three Monday tests that we expected yesterday morning were transmitted tonight. That's probably because they fixed something yesterday?!

• BUT: The receipts from yesterday's statements were not transferred. We looked on your server! This also fits in with the fact that the trips did not reach us in CSV format.

• We did the following tests yesterday:

o 12017026: msg systems ag

o 12017172: Conplan

o 12017197: Legacy Portfolio Partners GmbH

o 12017211: minnosphere

o 12017349: msg communications

o 12017373: msg David

o 12017398: Gillardon

o 12017411: mia

o 12017426: Rethink

o 12017450: msg services GmbH

o K.LAB: 12017519

o DIPKO: 12017556

o PIAL: 12017598

It may be that one of the three most recent statements was not approved. Here the approval is not in the hands of our travel management.;;;
column227:
19/Oct/22 12:38 PM;nsanchez;maybe a hint that will help with troubleshooting. The three test statements from Monday, which were delivered today in a CSV, were carried out for different companies, however, the cost center was always the same. If the cost center is the selection criterion for which statements the system writes in a CSV, this might explain why those three statements from different companies are transferred in one CSV.

Then the requirement would be to write all trips across companies and cost centers in one CSV (corresponding to the CSV that we export manually today).;;;
column228: 25/Oct/22 12:21 PM;nsanchez;as advised by Claudia via teams client requested implementation effective 1.1.22;;;
column231:
17/Nov/22 2:54 PM;djagodzki;Customer reported files from unwanted location on sftp server. Corresponding config in vegas should be adjusted to disable sftp transfer in location: \{*}msg nexinsure ag{*}.
To ensure data from *msg nexinsure ag* are not in system-wide CSV file a new auto-export job can be added, which would trigger all *nexinsure* statements without transferring them on the server. This job should start a minute before system-wide job.

The PR was created to fix PDFs and attachments from nexinsure appearing on SFTP server.

Waiting for confirmation on nexinsure auto export job.;;;

column223:
15/Sep/22 1:57 PM;mkuchciak;Hello [~nsanchez],

For {{ITEM_TEXT}}:

When description of credit posting records starts with "Erstattung" then it's populated by Expense Statement title. Otherwise the description of posting records is taken in account. In addition then max length of {{ITEM_TEXT}} is 50 characters.

For failing export I've created an ITE https://jira.ifao.net/browse/ITE-1146 as I couldn't find any footprints of potential issue.

Thank you!;;;

column232:
14/Nov/22 2:20 PM;ebert;[~wenner]  [~dykiert] 

after check on production, the current deployment on Bali does not reflect their currenty posting. They have no Credit Postings. Everything is done to Debit. 

However, after disucssion with ÖBB, they don't care if we post Credit or Debit, they only care for the correct Account. 

I assume that this implementation we currenty see on production was done because they asked to have the paid by company removed from Credit and doing this, Credit and Debit are no longer balanced (as paid by company generates a Credit and Debit line)

 

Please adjust the Posting on Bali. 

 

This whole posting needs discussion with Marius for a scenario that is not possible today - you either say - post paid by company, or do not post paid by company. But it is not possible to say, only post Credit / Debit.

A custom script for sure is not the best way as you can see from the massive questions and issues we face with this CI;;;

So please adjust the posting to the way it works in production, making sure we take the proper accounts as on Bali.

column1: ÖBB: Paid by Company for Flight only present in Betriebsvereinbarung
column26:
*Current Situation*

Users that are assigned to a Collective Agreement that is different from 'Betriebsvereinbarung' get the paid by company Flight receipts accounted to 864I

 

*Future Situation*

Users that are assigned to a Collective Agreement that is different from 'Betriebsvereinbarung' get the paid by company Flight receipts accounted to the correct account to 964Z

 

 

*Root Cause*

This is missing in the other configuration files. It was only set for 'Betriebsvereinbarung'

https://repository.secure.ifao.net:7443/projects/EXP/repos/engine-configs/browse/CalculationConfiguration/oebb/at/bv_oebb/20180101-99990101/customlogic.properties.xml#916

column1: Porsche - Extension of allowed period (12 to 17 months)
column26:
Hello team,

Could you please uodate the Extension of allowed period (12 to 17 months).

Customers receive an error when calculating receipts dated one year(12 month) ago. That's because dates 12 months in advance are not allowed. Please update the Extend this to calculate dates from 12 months to 17 months.

column1: INEOS - Update receipt name and src descripiton text
column26:
Hello team,

Could you please update receipt name and src descripiton text.

Old receipt type / Change to new receipt type / GL Account no.
 1. Car for domestic trip --> Domestic travel expenses / 685950
 2. Employee advance_N --> Accrual other / 390001
 3. Misc Travel Expenses --> Misc oversea travel expenses /685400
{code:java}
<typeName code="expense.basereceipt.receipt.companyCar">
 <name locale="en_US">Domestic travel expenses</name>
 <name locale="en_GB">Domestic travel expenses</name>
 <name locale="fr_FR">Domestic travel expenses</name>
 <name locale="de_DE">Domestic travel expenses</name>
</typeName>

<typeName code="expense.basereceipt.receipt.employee.advance">
 <name locale="en_US">Accrual other</name>
 <name locale="en_GB">Accrual other</name>
 <name locale="fr_FR">Accrual other</name>
 <name locale="de_DE">Accrual other</name>
</typeName>

<typeName code="expense.basereceipt.receipt.misc.travel.expenses">
 <name locale="en_US">Misc oversea travel expenses</name>
 <name locale="en_GB">Misc oversea travel expenses</name>
 <name locale="fr_FR">Misc oversea travel expenses</name>
 <name locale="de_DE">Misc oversea travel expenses</name>
</typeName>

{code}
